doc.title: DPC Dash Ltd
doc.source_uri: 2025-08-29/1H25 better than feared negative SSSG in the price cut PO to HK105 reiterate Buy1H25 better than feared negative SSSG in_2025-08-29

passages.text: Reiterate Rating: BUY | PO: 105.00 HKD | Price: 83.65 HKD

DPC's 1H25 results came in better than feared. Revenue was \(+27\%\) and adjusted NPAT rose to RMB91mn, with adjusted NPM of \(3.5\%\) . SSSG was \(- 1\%\) , including of stores opened in 2022 but with a high base. This came in better than feared. We cut 2025/26 EPS by \(19\% /19\%\) and PO by \(17\%\) to HK\\$105 on softer margin outlook. We expect 2H25 store opening to be on track, with net addition of \(110(+29.8\%\) YoY), which could be partially offset by SSSG pressure. Adjusted NPM in 2H would be slightly better than 1H, supported by kicking in of high- margin stores and operating leverage. We note that the share price has corrected by \(22\%\) since July (MXCN: \(+9\%\) ), largely due to concerns about negative SSSG. In our view, negative SSSG will weigh on store- level margin expansion during 2025- 26. On a positive note, DPC is gradually opening delivery for stores opened post 2023, and recent platform subsidies bodes well for SSSG. With SSSG base normalizing in 2027, margin expansion pace likely to resume then. Despite non- linear margin expansion trajectory, we believe DPC's normalized NPM is likely to reach \(6\% +\) once store count hits 2k in 2027. Reiterate Buy.

Revenue was \(+27\%\) YoY, driven by fast store expansion (net add 190 to 1,198, implying \(31\%\) YoY), with \(4\%\) average daily sales decline off a high base. SSSG of \(- 1\%\) was dragged by stores opened in 2023, but SSS for stores opened before then was positive. DPC expanded its presence into 43 cities, up from 39, as of end- 2024. Given the rapid expansion into new cities, revenue contribution from non- tier 1 markets accounted for \(58\%\) in 1H25, up from \(50\%\) in 1H24. We noticed delivery's contribution rose in tier- 1 cities, but largely stable at c. \(46\%\) at group level, similar as 2024 level, suggesting many stores opened in 2023 onwards offer limited delivery service given capacity constraint. Core OPM expanded 107bps to \(6.3\%\) due to 1) Store OPM expansion of 11bp to \(14.6\%\) despite SSS decline, driven by above- average new store margins; and 2) headquarters expense/revenue ratio was \(- 193\mathrm{bp}\) to \(9.3\%\) , on operating leverage. As such, adjusted net profit was \(+79.6\%\) to RMB91mn, with adjusted NPM of \(3.5\% (+1\) ppt YoY).

DPC is the exclusive master franchisee of Domino's Pizza in mainland China, Hong Kong and Macau. DPC has operated Domino's Pizza stores since 2010 and listed on the Hong Kong Stock Exchange in 2023. As of end- 24, DPC directly operated more than 1000 stores across 39 cities in mainland China and ranked third among China pizza peers in terms of revenue in 2021.

We rate DPC as Buy. As the exclusive master franchisee of a leading global brand, DPC is expected to deliver strong growth, leveraging rapid development of China pizza delivery market and its strong delivery and digital capability. Its fast- growing network, improving SSSG, and improving profitability serve as long- term growth drivers.
We cut our 2025/26E-adjusted EPS by \(19\% /19\%\)
Source: BofA Global Research estimates \\* Adjusted for FV change of financial liability at FV through P/L, share-based compensation, and listing expenses
BofA GLOBAL RESEARCH

We cut our 2025/26E EPS by \(19\% /19\%\) and PO by \(17\%\) . Our PO for DPC is HK\$105, based on a 50/50 blend of DCF and P/E methodology. Our DCF- derived valuation is HK\$115, based on \(12\%\) WACC ( \(3\%\) risk- free rate, \(9\%\) market premium, and \(1.0x\) beta) and \(3.5\%\) terminal growth (unchanged). Our P/E- driven valuation is HK\$95, using 35x P/E on FY26E (unchanged), which implies 0.6x PEG. We also assume HKD/CNY at 0.89, based on our house view.

Our PO for DPC is HK\\$105, based on a 50/50 blend of DCF and P/E methodology. Our DCF- derived valuation is HK\\$115, based on 12% WACC (3% risk- free rate, 9% market premium, and 1.0x beta) and 3.5% terminal growth. Our P/E- driven valuation is HK\\$95, using 35x P/E on FY26E, which implies 0.6x PEG. We also assume HKD/CNY at 0.89, based on our house view.
Upside risks: Faster- than- expected store expansion, stronger- than- expected market share gain pace, lower- than- expected cost inflation, and lower market competition.

Downside risks: Execution risk on expansion, outbreak of epidemics and pandemics, change in consumer food and dining preferences, competition risk, high concentration in tier 1 cities, food price inflation, labor cost and contractual relationships with riders, brand and reputation risk, franchise risk, food safety and restaurant hygiene risk, key personnel risk.
